column1: '''''When evening in the Shire was grey''''' is a poem
column2: written by [[Frodo Baggins]] in [[Lothlórien]] in {{TA|3019}}. It is a lament for [[Gandalf]]

column1: ''with [[Great Eagles|bird]] on bough and [[Beorn|beast]] in den
''in their own secret tongues he spoke.
''a back that bent beneath his load;
''A lord of wisdom throned he sat
''an old man in a battered hat
''He stood upon the [[Bridge of Khazad-dûm|bridge]] alone
''his staff was broken on the stone
Upon hearing this poem [[Samwise Gamgee]] suggested another stanza:
''they burst in stars of blue and green
''came falling like a rain of flowers.''</poem>
